question: Ano ang pinakamataas na batas ng lupain?

correctAnswers.rationale: The Constitution ang batayan at pinakamataas na batas of the U.S. government.

wrongAnswers.rationale: The Declaration of Independence mahalagang dokumento that declared independence, ngunit hindi ito batas.
The Bill of Rights bahagi ng Konstitusyon (the first 10 amendments), not the entire supreme law itself.
The Federalist Papers mga serye ng sanaysay written upang makumbinsi ang mga tao na aprubahan the Constitution.

question: Ano ang ginagawa ng Konstitusyon?

correctAnswers.rationale: Isa sa mga pangunahing tungkulin of the Constitution ay magtatatag at tukuyin the government.
The Constitution tinutukoy ang mga kapangyarihan at responsibilidad of each branch of government.

correctAnswers.text: pinoprotektahan ang mga pangunahing karapatan ng mga Amerikano
correctAnswers.rationale: Ilang amendment, including the Bill of Rights, pinoprotektahan ang mga pangunahing karapatan of citizens.

wrongAnswers.text: pumipili ng Pangulo, gumagawa ng batas, nangongolekta ng buwis
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang Konstitusyon ay naglalarawan ng proseso para sa pagpili ng Pangulo, ngunit hindi ito mismo ang pumipili ng Pangulo. Ang mga batas ay ginagawa ng Kongreso, hindi direkta ng Konstitusyon. Ang pagkolekta ng buwis ay kapangyarihang ibinigay sa Kongreso ng Konstitusyon, hindi aksyon ng Konstitusyon mismo.

wrongAnswers.text: nagpapatupad ng batas, nangunguna sa hukbo, nakikipag-usap sa mga kasunduan
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ito ay mga kapangyarihan ng executive branch na ibinigay ng Konstitusyon, ngunit hindi ito ang ginagawa ng Konstitusyon mismo.

wrongAnswers.text: nagbibigay-kahulugan sa batas, nagresolba ng mga alitan, nagsusuri ng mga kaso sa korte
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ito ay mga tungkulin ng judicial branch na itinatag ng Konstitusyon, ngunit hindi ito direktang aksyon ng Konstitusyon mismo.

question: Ang ideya ng sariling pamahalaan ay nasa unang tatlong salita ng Konstitusyon. Ano ang mga salitang ito?

correctAnswers.rationale: These words symbolize that the power of the government comes from the people.

wrongAnswers.rationale: This is the beginning of Lincoln's Gettysburg Address.
This is a phrase from Article I of the Constitution.
This is the beginning of the Pledge of Allegiance.

question: Ano ang isang amendment?

correctAnswers.rationale: An amendment is a change to the Constitution.
An amendment is an addition to the Constitution.

wrongAnswers.text: bagong batas, desisyon ng Kataas-taasang Hukuman, utos ng Pangulo
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang bagong batas ay ginagawa ng Kongreso at iba sa amendment na nagbabago sa Konstitusyon mismo. Ang desisyon ng Kataas-taasang Hukuman ay nagbibigay-kahulugan sa batas, ngunit hindi direktang binabago ang teksto ng Konstitusyon. Ang utos ng Pangulo ay direktiba mula sa Pangulo para sa pamamahala ng executive branch; hindi nito maaaring baguhin ang Konstitusyon.

wrongAnswers.text: kasunduan, executive agreement, resolusyon ng Kongreso
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang kasunduan ay internasyonal na kasunduan na nangangailangan ng pag-apruba ng Senado ngunit hindi binabago ang Konstitusyon. Ang executive agreement ay ginagawa ng Pangulo sa mga bansang dayuhan nang walang pag-apruba ng Senado. Ang resolusyon ng Kongreso ay nagpapahayag ng opinyon ng Kongreso ngunit hindi nag-aaamend sa Konstitusyon.

wrongAnswers.text: batas ng estado, lokal na ordinansa, pederal na regulasyon
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang batas ng estado ay nalalapat lamang sa loob ng estadong iyon at hindi maaaring baguhin ang pederal na Konstitusyon. Ang lokal na ordinansa ay batas na ipinasa ng lungsod o county government. Ang pederal na regulasyon ay panuntunang ginawa ng mga pederal na ahensya para ipatupad ang mga batas, ngunit hindi maaaring baguhin ang Konstitusyon.

question: Ano ang tawag natin sa unang sampung amendment ng Konstitusyon?

correctAnswers.rationale: These ten amendments guarantee core individual rights and freedoms.

wrongAnswers.rationale: The Declaration of Independence, from 1776, declared independence and is not a set of constitutional amendments.
The Federalist Papers mga serye ng sanaysay written upang makumbinsi ang mga tao na aprubahan the Constitution.
The Emancipation Proclamation was an executive order by Lincoln that freed slaves in the Confederacy.

question: Ano ang isang karapatan o kalayaan mula sa Unang Amendment?

correctAnswers.rationale: The First Amendment prohibits the government from interfering with an individual's choice of religion.
The First Amendment prohibits the government from unduly suppressing individual expression.
People have the right to gather peacefully and share their opinions.
This is the right to print and distribute information without prior government censorship.
Citizens have the right to request changes in government policy.

wrongAnswers.rationale: While important, the right to vote is protected by other amendments (like the 15th, 19th, and 26th), not the First.
The right to bear arms is a right protected by the Second Amendment.

wrongAnswers.text: the right to the pursuit of happiness
wrongAnswers.rationale: The 'pursuit of happiness' is an ideal right mentioned in the Declaration of Independence.

question: Ilang amendment ang mayroon ang Konstitusyon?

correctAnswers.rationale: After the Bill of Rights in 1791, 17 more have been added, for a total of 27.

wrongAnswers.rationale: Ten is the number of amendments in the Bill of Rights.
Fifty is the number of states in the U.S.
Thirteen is the number of the original colonies (states) when the U.S. was founded.

question: Ano ang ginawa ng Deklarasyon ng Kalayaan?

correctAnswers.rationale: It announced to the world that the colonies were no longer under British rule.

correctAnswers.text: [번역 필요] declared our independence (from Great Britain)
correctAnswers.rationale: [번역 필요] The Declaration formally declared the colonies' independence from British rule.

correctAnswers.text: [번역 필요] said that the United States is free (from Great Britain)
correctAnswers.rationale: [번역 필요] The Declaration stated that the United States was a free and independent nation.

wrongAnswers.text: gave women the right to vote
wrongAnswers.rationale: Women's right to vote was granted by the 19th Amendment, ratified in 1920.
The slaves were freed by Lincoln's Emancipation Proclamation in 1863 and later the 13th Amendment.
The Constitution was created later, at the Constitutional Convention in 1787.

question: Ano ang dalawang karapatan sa Deklarasyon ng Kalayaan?

correctAnswers.rationale: Life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness are the unalienable rights listed in the Declaration.
kalayaan is one of the three unalienable rights listed in the Declaration of Independence.
The paghahanap ng kaligayahan is one of the three unalienable rights listed in the Declaration of Independence.

wrongAnswers.rationale: Freedom of speech and religion are rights listed in the Bill of Rights (the First Amendment).

wrongAnswers.text: the right to vote and run for office
wrongAnswers.rationale: These are important rights for U.S. citizens, but they are defined by the Constitution, not the Declaration of Independence.

wrongAnswers.text: the right to own property and education
wrongAnswers.rationale: These are important rights, but they are not the three core unalienable rights mentioned in the Declaration.

question: Ano ang kalayaang panrelihiyon?

correctAnswers.text: Maaari kang magsanay ng anumang relihiyon, o hindi magsanay ng relihiyon
correctAnswers.rationale: The U.S. does not have a state religion, and the government cannot interfere with an individual's choice.

wrongAnswers.rationale: The U.S. does not have an official state religion and guarantees freedom for all religions, or no religion.

wrongAnswers.text: You must practice a religion approved by the government
wrongAnswers.rationale: This is incorrect; government approval is not needed and would violate the principle of religious freedom.

wrongAnswers.text: You must pay a tax on your religious activities
wrongAnswers.rationale: Religious activities are generally tax-exempt, as taxing them could suppress religious freedom.

question: Ano ang sistemang pang-ekonomiya sa Estados Unidos?

correctAnswers.rationale: The U.S. operates under a capitalist economy, based on private property and free markets.
A market economy, where prices are determined by supply and demand, also describes the U.S. economic system.

wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang sosyalistang ekonomiya ay nagsasangkot ng pagmamay-ari ng estado o komunidad sa mga pamamaraan ng produksyon, na naiiba sa modelo ng pribadong ari-arian ng U.S. Ang komunistang ekonomiya ay nagtatampok ng pagkakaparehong ari-arian at kumpletong kontrol ng estado sa produksyon at pamamahagi, na kabaligtaran ng sistema ng malayang merkado ng U.S.

Ang merkantilismo ay isang 16th-18th century European na patakaran kung saan kinokontrol ng estado ang kalakalan upang mag-ipon ng yaman, na naiiba sa malayang kalakalan ng U.S. Ang pyudal na ekonomiya ay nakabatay sa pagmamay-ari ng lupa at mga obligasyong pang-agrikulturang paggawa, na lubhang naiiba sa mga modernong kapitalistang sistema.

Ang command economy ay lubos na kinokontrol ng gobyerno, na nagdedesisyon kung ano ang dapat gawin at ipamahagi, na naiiba sa market-driven na sistema ng U.S. Ang planned economy ay nagsasangkot ng sentral na pagpaplano ng gobyerno sa lahat ng aktibidad sa ekonomiya, na kumakontrasta sa sistema ng U.S. kung saan ang mga pwersa ng merkado ang nagdedesisyon sa ekonomiya.

question: Ano ang 'paghahari ng batas'?

correctAnswers.text: Lahat ay dapat sumunod sa batas
correctAnswers.rationale: The rule of law is the principle that all people are subject to and accountable under the law, regardless of status.

correctAnswers.text: Ang mga pinuno ay dapat sumunod sa batas
correctAnswers.rationale: Government leaders, including the President, are also subject to the rule of law.
This phrase best summarizes the core principle of the rule of law.

correctAnswers.text: [번역 필요] Government must obey the law
correctAnswers.rationale: [번역 필요] The government itself is also bound by the law and cannot act outside its legal authority.

wrongAnswers.text: Ang mga batas ay palaging nagbabago, ang Pangulo ang gumagawa ng batas, lahat ng batas ay makatarungan
wrongAnswers.rationale: Habang maaaring magbago ang mga batas, hindi ito ang kahulugan ng paghahari ng batas. Ang Kongreso ang gumagawa ng batas, at ang Pangulo ay nagpapatupad nito. Ang paghahari ng batas ay naglalayong maging makatarungan, ngunit hindi ito nagsasabing perpektong makatarungan ang bawat batas.

wrongAnswers.text: Ang mga mamamayan lang ang sumusunod sa batas, may iba't ibang batas para sa mga mayaman, ang mga opisyal ng pamahalaan ay exempted sa batas
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang mga pahayag na ito ay sumasalungat sa paghahari ng batas na nagsasabing lahat ng tao, anuman ang katayuan o yaman, ay dapat parehong sumunod sa batas.

wrongAnswers.text: Ang batas ay rekomendasyon lamang, maaaring piliin ng mga tao kung susundin ang batas, ang batas ay ginagamit lamang sa emergency
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang mga pahayag na ito ay mali dahil ang batas ay sapilitan at dapat sundin ng lahat ng tao sa lahat ng oras, hindi lamang sa emergency.

question: Banggitin ang isang sangay o bahagi ng pamahalaan.

correctAnswers.rationale: Congress is the legislative branch, which makes laws.
The President is the head of the executive branch, which carries out laws.
The courts are the judicial branch, which interprets and applies laws.

wrongAnswers.text: ang mga estado, ang militar, ang pulisya
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang mga estado ay mahalagang bahagi ng federal system, ngunit hindi isa sa tatlong sangay ng federal government. Ang militar ay mahalagang institusyon na kontrolado ng executive branch, ngunit hindi hiwalay na sangay ng pamahalaan. Ang pulisya ay mga ahensyang nagpapatupad ng batas, karaniwang nasa ilalim ng estado o lokal na pamahalaan.

wrongAnswers.text: ang Gabinete, ang Senado, ang House
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang Gabinete ay bahagi ng executive branch, habang ang Senado at House ay parehong bahagi ng legislative branch, hindi hiwalay na mga sangay.

wrongAnswers.text: ang FBI, ang CIA, ang Supreme Court
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang FBI at CIA ay mga ahensya sa loob ng executive branch, habang ang Supreme Court ay bahagi ng judicial branch, hindi hiwalay na mga sangay ng pamahalaan.

question: Ano ang pumipigil sa isang sangay ng pamahalaan na maging masyadong makapangyarihan?

correctAnswers.rationale: This is the system where each branch can review and limit the powers of the others.
This is the principle of dividing governmental power among the legislative, executive, and judicial branches.

wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang paghahari ng batas ay tumutulong na mapigilan ang pang-aabuso ng kapangyarihan ngunit hindi ito ang tiyak na sistema na pumipigil sa isang sangay na maging masyadong makapangyarihan. Ang federalismo ay prinsipyo ng pagbabahagi ng kapangyarihan sa pagitan ng federal at state governments, hindi sa pagitan ng tatlong sangay ng pamahalaan. Walang direktang tumutugon sa constitutional mechanism para mapigilan ang isang sangay na magdomina sa iba.

Ang mga limitasyon sa termino at halalan ay mga demokratikong mekanismo na maaaring maglimita sa kapangyarihan ng pamahalaan at magbigay ng accountability, ngunit hindi sila ang constitutional system na partikular na idinisenyo para mapigilan ang isang sangay ng pamahalaan na maging masyadong makapangyarihan sa pamamagitan ng mutual oversight at restraint.

wrongAnswers.text: ang Tuntunin ng mga Karapatan, impeachment
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang Tuntunin ng mga Karapatan ay nagpoprotekta sa mga kalayaang pansarili mula sa labis na kapangyarihan ng pamahalaan ngunit hindi direktang tumutugon sa balanse ng kapangyarihan sa pagitan ng mga sangay. Ang impeachment ay tiyak na mekanismo para tanggalin ang mga opisyal dahil sa misconduct, ngunit hindi ito ang mas malawakang sistema na pumipigil sa dominasyon ng isang sangay sa pamamagitan ng tuloy-tuloy na mutual checks.

question: Sino ang namamahala sa sangay na ehekutibo?

correctAnswers.rationale: The President is the chief of the executive branch.

wrongAnswers.rationale: The Speaker of the House is the leader of the House of Representatives, which is in the legislative branch.
The Chief Justice is the head of the Supreme Court, which is in the judicial branch.
The Secretary of State is a high-ranking cabinet member in the executive branch, but not the head of the entire branch.

question: Sino ang gumagawa ng mga pederal na batas?

correctAnswers.rationale: Federal laws ginawa ng Kongreso (the Senate and House).
[번역 필요] Congress consists of the Senate and House of Representatives, which together make federal laws.
[번역 필요] The U.S. legislature, which is Congress, has the constitutional authority to make federal laws.

wrongAnswers.rationale: The President signs bills passed by Congress into law, but does not create the laws.
The Supreme Court interprets laws and decides if they are constitutional, but it does not make them.
State legislatures make state laws, not federal laws.

question: Ano ang dalawang bahagi ng Kongreso ng Estados Unidos?

correctAnswers.text: ang Senado at Kapulungan (ng mga Kinatawan)
correctAnswers.rationale: The U.S. Congress is a bicameral legislature, consisting of the Senate and the House.

wrongAnswers.rationale: This describes the executive branch.
This describes the structure of the judicial branch.
These are the major political parties in the U.S.

question: Ilan ang mga Senador ng Estados Unidos?

correctAnswers.rationale: There are two senators from each of the 50 states, totaling 100.

wrongAnswers.rationale: 435 is the number of members in the House of Representatives.
50 is the number of states in the U.S.
Nine is the number of justices on the Supreme Court.

question: Pinipili natin ang isang Senador ng Estados Unidos sa loob ng ilang taon?

correctAnswers.rationale: The term for a U.S. Senator is six years.

wrongAnswers.rationale: Two years is the term for a member of the House of Representatives.
Four years is the term for the President.
A President can serve a maximum of two terms, or eight years, but this is different from a Senator's term.

question: Who is one of your state’s U.S. Senators now?

correctAnswers.rationale: Ang sagot sa tanong na ito ay depende sa inyong estado/distrito. Dapat kayong tingnan ang mga opisyal na website.

wrongAnswers.rationale: The Governor is the head of the state's executive branch, not a federal Senator.
A Representative is a member of the House of Representatives, which is different from a Senator.
The President is the head of the federal executive branch.

question: Ang Kapulungan ng mga Kinatawan ay may ilang miyembrong may karapatang bumoto?

correctAnswers.rationale: The number of representatives is based on each state's population.

wrongAnswers.rationale: 100 is the number of Senators.
50 is the number of states.
538 is the total number of electors in the Electoral College.

question: Pinipili natin ang isang Kinatawan ng Estados Unidos sa loob ng ilang taon?

correctAnswers.rationale: The term for a U.S. Representative is two years.

wrongAnswers.rationale: Four years is the term for the President.
Six years is the term for a Senator.
Supreme Court justices serve for life, but Representatives are elected officials.

question: Banggitin ang inyong Kinatawan ng Estados Unidos.

correctAnswers.rationale: Ang sagot sa tanong na ito ay depende sa inyong estado/distrito. Dapat kayong tingnan ang mga opisyal na website.

wrongAnswers.rationale: A Senator represents the entire state and is different from a Representative for a specific district.
The Governor is the head of the state's executive branch.
The Mayor is the head of a city's government.

question: Sino ang kinakatawan ng isang Senador ng Estados Unidos?

correctAnswers.rationale: Senators represent the interests of their entire state, not just a specific district.

wrongAnswers.rationale: While they belong to a political party, Senators are legally bound to represent all the people of their state.

wrongAnswers.text: only the city they live in
wrongAnswers.rationale: Senators represent the entire state, not just one city.
As part of the legislative branch, Senators provide a check on the President, who heads the executive branch.

question: Bakit may mga estado na may mas maraming Kinatawan kaysa sa ibang estado?

correctAnswers.rationale: The number of representatives is apportioned based on each state's population, as determined by the census every 10 years.
[번역 필요] States with larger populations get more representatives in the House.

correctAnswers.text: [번역 필요] (because) some states have more people
correctAnswers.rationale: [번역 필요] The number of representatives is directly related to how many people live in each state.

wrongAnswers.rationale: The number of representatives is based on population, not the physical size of the state.
Population, not the state's economic power, is the standard.

wrongAnswers.text: because of when the state was founded
wrongAnswers.rationale: The order in which a state joined the Union does not affect its number of representatives.

correctAnswers.rationale: The term for the President is four years.

wrongAnswers.rationale: Two years is the term for a member of the House of Representatives.
Six years is the term for a Senator.
There are no federal offices in the U.S. with a five-year term.

question: Sa anong buwan tayo bumoboto para sa Pangulo?

correctAnswers.rationale: The U.S. presidential election is held every four years on the Tuesday after the first Monday in November.

wrongAnswers.rationale: The new President is inaugurated in January.
July 4th is Independence Day.
October is typically a time of intense, final-stage campaigning before the election.

wrongAnswers.rationale: JD Vance is the current Vice President.

wrongAnswers.rationale: Donald J. Trump is the current President.

question: Kung hindi na makakapaglingkod ang Pangulo, sino ang magiging Pangulo?

correctAnswers.rationale: The Vice President succeeds to the presidency if the President can no longer serve.

wrongAnswers.rationale: The Speaker of the House succeeds to the presidency only if both the President and Vice President can no longer serve.
The Chief Justice is not in the line of presidential succession.
The Secretary of State is fourth in the line of presidential succession.

question: Kung pareho nang hindi makakapaglingkod ang Pangulo at Pangalawang Pangulo, sino ang magiging Pangulo?

correctAnswers.rationale: The Speaker of the House is third in the line of presidential succession.

wrongAnswers.rationale: The Secretary of State is fourth in the line of succession, after the Speaker of the House.
The Chief Justice is not in the line of presidential succession.

wrongAnswers.text: the President pro tempore of the Senate
wrongAnswers.rationale: The President pro tempore of the Senate is fourth in line, after the Speaker of the House.

question: Sino ang Kumander-in-Chief ng militar?

correctAnswers.rationale: The President holds the ultimate authority over the U.S. armed forces as Commander in Chief.

wrongAnswers.rationale: The Secretary of Defense is the civilian head of the Department of Defense, acting under the President's command.

wrongAnswers.text: the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff
wrongAnswers.rationale: The Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff is the highest-ranking military officer and the principal military advisor to the President.
The Vice President does not have direct command authority over the military.

question: Sino ang pumipirma sa mga panukalang-batas upang maging batas?

correctAnswers.rationale: A bill passed by Congress must be signed by the President to become law.

wrongAnswers.rationale: The Speaker of the House leads the process for a bill to pass the House, but does not have the final authority to sign it into law.
The Vice President can cast a tie-breaking vote in the Senate but does not sign bills into law.
The Chief Justice interprets laws and is not involved in the legislative process.

question: Sino ang nag-veto ng mga panukalang-batas?

correctAnswers.rationale: The President has the power to veto bills passed by Congress.

wrongAnswers.rationale: Congress passes bills; it can also override a presidential veto.
The Supreme Court can rule a law unconstitutional after it is enacted, but it cannot veto a bill.
A Governor has veto power over state laws, not federal laws.

question: What does the President’s Cabinet do?

correctAnswers.rationale: The Cabinet, composed of the heads of executive departments, provides expert advice to the President.

wrongAnswers.rationale: Laws ginawa ng Kongreso.
The President is elected by the people and the Electoral College.
Declaring war is an exclusive power of Congress.

question: Ano ang dalawang posisyon sa antas ng Gabinete?

correctAnswers.rationale: The Secretary of State is a key cabinet member responsible for foreign policy.
The Secretary of the Treasury is responsible for the nation's financial and economic policy.
The Secretary of Defense oversees military and defense policy.
The Attorney General is the head of the Department of Justice and the chief law enforcement officer.
[번역 필요] The Secretary of Agriculture oversees farming, food safety, and rural development policies.
[번역 필요] The Secretary of Commerce promotes economic growth and trade.
[번역 필요] The Secretary of Education oversees federal education policy and programs.
[번역 필요] The Secretary of Energy manages energy policy and nuclear security.

correctAnswers.text: [번역 필요] Secretary of Health and Human Services
correctAnswers.rationale: [번역 필요] The Secretary of Health and Human Services oversees health and welfare programs.
[번역 필요] The Secretary of Homeland Security protects the nation from security threats.

correctAnswers.text: [번역 필요] Secretary of Housing and Urban Development
correctAnswers.rationale: [번역 필요] The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development oversees housing and urban development policies.
[번역 필요] The Secretary of the Interior manages public lands and natural resources.
[번역 필요] The Secretary of Labor oversees workplace safety and labor relations.
[번역 필요] The Secretary of Transportation oversees transportation infrastructure and safety.
[번역 필요] The Secretary of Veterans Affairs provides services to military veterans.
[번역 필요] The Vice President is also considered a Cabinet-level position.

wrongAnswers.rationale: The Chief Justice is the head of the judicial branch and not a member of the executive Cabinet.
The Speaker of the House is a leader in the legislative branch, not a member of the Cabinet.
A Senator is a member of the legislative branch.

question: Ano ang ginagawa ng sangay na hudisyal?

correctAnswers.rationale: The judicial branch reviews laws to ensure they are constitutional.
The judicial branch interprets the meaning of laws and applies them to specific cases.
It resolves legal disputes by making rulings.

correctAnswers.text: [번역 필요] decides if a law goes against the Constitution
correctAnswers.rationale: [번역 필요] The judicial branch has the power of judicial review to determine if laws are constitutional.

wrongAnswers.text: gumagawa ng batas, nagpapatupad ng batas, nagbibigay ng payo sa Pangulo

wrongAnswers.text: nangongolekta ng buwis, naglilimbag ng pera, nireregula ang kalakalan
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ito ay mga kapangyarihan ng Congress, hindi ng judicial branch.

wrongAnswers.text: nangunguna sa hukbo, nakikipag-usap sa mga kasunduan, nagtatalaga ng mga embahador
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ito ay mga kapangyarihan ng Pangulo, hindi ng judicial branch.

question: Ano ang pinakamataas na korte sa Estados Unidos?

correctAnswers.rationale: The Supreme Court is the highest court in the U.S. judicial system.

wrongAnswers.rationale: A state Supreme Court is the highest in that state's judicial system, but the U.S. Supreme Court is higher for the entire nation.
A court of appeals is a lower court than the Supreme Court.
The International Court of Justice is a UN judicial body that handles disputes between countries.

question: Ilan ang mga hukom sa Kataas-taasang Hukuman?

correctAnswers.rationale: The Supreme Court is composed of one Chief Justice and eight Associate Justices.

wrongAnswers.rationale: The number of justices is set by law and has been nine since 1869.
Twelve relates to the number of regional circuit courts of appeals, not the number of Supreme Court justices.
Fifty is the number of states.

question: Sino ang Punong Hukom ng Estados Unidos ngayon?

correctAnswers.rationale: John G. Roberts, Jr. is the 17th and current Chief Justice.

wrongAnswers.rationale: Clarence Thomas is the current longest-serving Associate Justice.

Ruth Bader Ginsburg was a revered Associate Justice who passed away in 2020.

question: Sa ilalim ng aming Konstitusyon, ang ilang kapangyarihan ay pag-aari ng federal government. Ano ang isang kapangyarihan ng federal government?

correctAnswers.rationale: Printing money is an exclusive power of the federal government.
Declaring war is a power of the federal Congress.
Creating and maintaining an army for national defense is a role of the federal government.
Making official treaties with other countries is a power of the federal government.

wrongAnswers.text: magbigay ng driver's license, magbigay ng pag-aaral at edukasyon, magbigay ng proteksyon (pulis)
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang pagbibigay ng driver's license ay kapangyarihan ng mga indibidwal na estado. Ang pagpapatakbo ng mga sistema ng edukasyon ay pangunahing responsibilidad ng mga estado at lokal na pamahalaan. Ang pagbibigay ng mga puwersa ng pulis ay pangunahing kapangyarihan ng mga estado at lokal na pamahalaan.

wrongAnswers.text: mag-regulate ng mga batas sa kasal, magsagawa ng halalan, magtayo ng mga lokal na korte
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang lahat ng ito ay mga kapangyarihan na pag-aari ng mga pamahalaan ng estado, hindi ng federal government.

wrongAnswers.text: mag-isyu ng mga propesyonal na lisensya, mag-regulate ng intrastate commerce, mamahala ng mga likas na yaman
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang mga ito ay mga karagdagang halimbawa ng mga kapangyarihan ng estado, hindi mga kapangyarihan ng federal government.

question: Sa ilalim ng aming Konstitusyon, ang ilang kapangyarihan ay pag-aari ng mga estado. Ano ang isang kapangyarihan ng mga estado?

correctAnswers.rationale: Education policy and school operation are primarily the responsibility of the states.
Maintaining public order by operating state and local police is a state power.
Each state sets its own standards and procedures for issuing driver's licenses.
[번역 필요] Fire protection and safety services are typically provided by state and local governments.

correctAnswers.text: [번역 필요] approve zoning and land use
correctAnswers.rationale: [번역 필요] States have the authority to regulate land use and zoning within their boundaries.

wrongAnswers.text: mag-print ng pera, magdeklara ng digmaan, gumawa ng mga kasunduan
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang pag-print ng pera ay eksklusibong kapangyarihan ng federal government, hindi ng mga estado. Ang pagdedeklara ng digmaan ay kapangyarihan ng federal Congress, hindi ng mga estado. Ang paggawa ng mga kasunduan sa ibang mga bansa ay kapangyarihan ng federal government, hindi ng mga estado.

wrongAnswers.text: mag-regulate ng interstate commerce, magtayo ng mga post office, mag-mint ng mga barya
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang lahat ng ito ay mga eksklusibong kapangyarihan ng federal government na hindi maaaring gawin ng mga estado.

wrongAnswers.text: lumikha ng hukbo, magtakda ng mga batas sa immigration, mag-regulate ng foreign trade
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang mga ito ay mga karagdagang federal powers na hindi binibigay sa mga indibidwal na estado sa ilalim ng Konstitusyon.

question: Sino ang Gobernador ng inyong estado ngayon?

correctAnswers.rationale: Ang sagot sa tanong na ito ay depende sa inyong estado/distrito. Dapat kayong tingnan ang mga opisyal na website.

wrongAnswers.rationale: A Senator is part of the federal legislative branch and is different from the Governor, who is the head of the state's executive branch.
The Mayor is the head of a city government, different from the Governor who is the head of the entire state.
The President is the head of the federal government, different from the Governor who is the head of a state government.

question: Ano ang kabisera ng inyong estado?

correctAnswers.rationale: Ang sagot sa tanong na ito ay depende sa inyong estado/distrito. Dapat kayong tingnan ang mga opisyal na website.

wrongAnswers.rationale: Washington, D.C. is the capital of the United States, not a state capital.

wrongAnswers.text: The name of the largest city
wrongAnswers.rationale: A state's capital is not always its largest city (e.g., the capital of New York is Albany).

wrongAnswers.text: The name of the most famous city
wrongAnswers.rationale: The most famous city is not necessarily the state capital.

question: Ano ang dalawang pangunahing partidong pampolitika sa Estados Unidos?

correctAnswers.rationale: The Democratic and Republican parties are the two major parties that dominate U.S. politics today.

wrongAnswers.rationale: The Labour and Conservative parties are the major political parties in the United Kingdom.
Parties like the Libertarian and Green parties are third parties in the U.S., but not one of the two major parties.
The Senate and House are the two parts of Congress, not political parties.

question: Ano ang partidong pampolitika ng Presidente ngayon?

correctAnswers.rationale: President Donald Trump is a member of the Republican Party. (As of July 2025)

wrongAnswers.rationale: The Democratic Party is currently the main opposition party.
The current President is a member of a major party, the Republican Party.
The Libertarian Party is one of the third parties in the U.S.

question: Ano ang pangalan ng Speaker ng House of Representatives ngayon?

correctAnswers.rationale: (As of July 2025)

wrongAnswers.rationale: Nancy Pelosi was a previous Speaker of the House.
Kevin McCarthy was the Speaker of the House immediately before Mike Johnson.
Chuck Schumer is the current Senate Majority Leader.

question: There are four amendments to the Constitution about who can vote. Describe one of them.

correctAnswers.rationale: The 26th Amendment lowered the voting age to 18.

correctAnswers.text: You don’t have to pay (a poll tax) to vote.
correctAnswers.rationale: The 24th Amendment outlawed the use of poll taxes as a voting requirement.

correctAnswers.text: Any citizen can vote. (Women and men can vote.)
correctAnswers.rationale: The 19th Amendment prohibited voting discrimination on the basis of sex.

correctAnswers.text: A male citizen of any race (can vote).
correctAnswers.rationale: The 15th Amendment prohibited voting discrimination on the basis of race.

wrongAnswers.text: Ang mga permanent resident ay maaaring bumoto, Tanging mga may-ari ng ari-arian lamang ang maaaring bumoto, Tanging mga taong 30 taong gulang pataas lamang ang maaaring bumoto
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang karapatan na bumoto sa mga pederal na halalan ay karaniwang nakalaan para sa mga mamamayang Amerikano, hindi sa mga permanent resident. Ang pagkakaroon ng ari-arian ay kinakailangan noong unang panahon, ngunit hindi na ito kinakailangan ngayon upang makaboto. Ang edad para sa pagboto ay 18 taong gulang pataas, hindi 30, ayon sa ika-26 na Amendment.

wrongAnswers.text: Tanging mga nakapagtapos ng kolehiyo lamang ang maaaring bumoto, Tanging mga kasal lamang ang maaaring bumoto, Tanging mga may trabaho lamang ang maaaring bumoto
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang antas ng edukasyon ay hindi kinakailangan sa pagboto sa Estados Unidos. Ang katayuan sa kasal ay hindi kailanman naging constitutional na kinakailangan para sa pagboto. Ang katayuan sa trabaho ay hindi kinakailangan sa pagboto; ang mga walang trabahong mamamayan ay napapanatili pa rin ang kanilang karapatan sa pagboto.

wrongAnswers.text: Tanging mga beterano ng militar lamang ang maaaring bumoto, Tanging mga may-ari ng bahay lamang ang maaaring bumoto, Tanging mga nagbabayad ng buwis lamang ang maaaring bumoto
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang serbisyong militar ay hindi kinakailangan upang makaboto; ang mga sibilyang mamamayan ay may pantay na karapatan sa pagboto. Ang pagkakaroon ng bahay ay hindi kinakailangan sa pagboto sa ilalim ng kasalukuyang batas. Bagaman karamihan sa mga botante ay nagbabayad ng ilang buwis, ang pagbabayad ng buwis ay hindi constitutional na kinakailangan upang makaboto.

question: What is one responsibility that is only for United States citizens?

correctAnswers.rationale: Jury duty is a key responsibility reserved for U.S. citizens.
Voting in a federal election is both a right and a key responsibility of a citizen.

wrongAnswers.text: magbayad ng buwis, sumunod sa batas, mag-rehistro sa Selective Service
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang pagbabayad ng buwis ay responsibilidad ng lahat ng mga residente na may kita (tulad ng mga permanent resident), hindi lamang ng mga mamamayan. Ang pagsunod sa batas ay responsibilidad ng lahat ng tao sa Estados Unidos. Ang pag-rehistro sa Selective Service ay responsibilidad ng mga lalaking mamamayan at mga lalaking permanent resident sa tiyak na edad.

wrongAnswers.text: kumuha ng lisensya sa pagmamaneho, kumuha ng Social Security number, magbukas ng bank account
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang lisensya sa pagmamaneho ay maaaring makuha ng sinumang residente, anuman ang pagkamamamayan. Ang Social Security number ay ibinibigay sa mga legal na residente at manggagawa. Ang pagbubukas ng bank account ay posible nang walang pagkamamamayan kung may tamang pagkakakilanlan.

wrongAnswers.text: karapatan sa edukasyon, karapatan sa emergency medical care, karapatan sa legal na proteksyon
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang pampublikong edukasyon ay ibinibigay sa lahat ng mga bata anuman ang pagkamamamayan. Ang emergency medical care ay available sa lahat ng tao anuman ang pagkamamamayan. Ang pangunahing legal na proteksyon ay nalalapat sa lahat ng tao sa teritoryo ng Estados Unidos.

question: Name one right only for United States citizens.

correctAnswers.rationale: Voting in federal elections is a right exclusive to citizens.
The right to run for federal office, such as President, Senator, or Representative, is reserved for citizens.

wrongAnswers.text: kalayaan sa relihiyon, kalayaan sa pananalita, karapatan na magmay-ari ng ari-arian
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang kalayaan sa relihiyon ay karapatan ng lahat ng tao sa Estados Unidos, hindi lamang ng mga mamamayan. Ang kalayaan sa pananalita ay karapatan ng lahat ng tao sa Estados Unidos, hindi lamang ng mga mamamayan. Ang karapatan na magmay-ari ng ari-arian ay karaniwang available sa mga hindi mamamayan sa Estados Unidos.

wrongAnswers.text: karapatan sa pampublikong edukasyon, karapatan sa emergency medical care, karapatan sa abogado
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang pampublikong edukasyon ay ibinibigay sa lahat ng mga bata anuman ang pagkamamamayan. Ang emergency medical care ay available sa lahat ng tao anuman ang pagkamamamayan. Ang karapatan sa abogado ay garantisado para sa lahat ng tao sa Estados Unidos.

wrongAnswers.text: kalayaan sa pagtitipon, kalayaan sa pamamahayag, karapatan sa petisyon
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang kalayaan sa pagtitipon ay garantisado ng Unang Amendment para sa lahat ng tao. Ang kalayaan sa pamamahayag ay pangunahing karapatan na garantisado anuman ang pagkamamamayan. Ang karapatan sa petisyon ay garantisado ng Unang Amendment para sa lahat ng tao.

question: What are two rights of everyone living in the United States?

correctAnswers.rationale: This is a fundamental right protected by the First Amendment.
This is a fundamental right protected by the First Amendment.
This is a fundamental right protected by the First Amendment.
This is a fundamental right protected by the First Amendment.
[번역 필요] Everyone in the U.S. has the right to practice any religion or no religion.

correctAnswers.text: [번역 필요] the right to bear arms
correctAnswers.rationale: [번역 필요] The Second Amendment protects the right to keep and bear arms.

wrongAnswers.text: karapatan na bumoto sa federal na halalan, karapatan na tumakbo sa federal na opisina, karapatan sa U.S. passport
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang karapatan na bumoto sa federal na halalan ay nakalaan lamang para sa mga U.S. citizen, hindi para sa lahat ng nakatira sa U.S. Ang karapatan na tumakbo sa federal na opisina ay nakalaan lamang para sa mga U.S. citizen. Ang mga U.S. passport ay inilalabas lamang sa mga U.S. citizen, hindi sa lahat ng residente.

wrongAnswers.text: karapatan na magsilbi sa jury, karapatan na mag-petition sa gobyerno, karapatan na magkaroon ng armas
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang paglilingkod sa jury ay karaniwang limitado sa mga citizen sa karamihan ng mga hurisdiksiyon. Ang karapatan na mag-petition sa gobyerno ay available sa lahat. Ang karapatan na magkaroon ng armas ay may ilang mga paghihigpit para sa mga hindi citizen, kaya hindi ito pangkalahatang available sa lahat ng residente.

wrongAnswers.text: karapatan sa Social Security benefits, karapatan sa Medicare, karapatan sa unemployment benefits
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang mga Social Security benefits ay pangunahin para sa mga citizen at awtorisadong manggagawa na nag-ambag. Ang Medicare ay pangunahin para sa mga citizen at permanent resident na nakakatugon sa mga kinakailangan. Ang mga unemployment benefits ay may mga kinakailangan sa citizenship o work authorization sa karamihan ng mga estado.

question: What do we show loyalty to when we say the Pledge of Allegiance?

correctAnswers.rationale: The Pledge of Allegiance is an expression of loyalty to the nation of the United States.
The flag symbolizes the United States, so pledging allegiance to it means showing loyalty to the country.

wrongAnswers.rationale: Loyalty is pledged to the nation itself, not to a specific person or government.
While loyalty to one's state is important, the Pledge of Allegiance is to the entire federal nation.
Citizens have a duty to uphold the Constitution, but the direct object of the Pledge of Allegiance is the United States and its flag.

question: What is one promise you make when you become a United States citizen?

correctAnswers.text: obey the laws of the United States
correctAnswers.rationale: The Oath of Allegiance includes a promise to obey the laws of the United States.

correctAnswers.text: be loyal to the United States
correctAnswers.rationale: This is a core part of the Oath of Allegiance.

correctAnswers.text: serve in the U.S. military (if needed)
correctAnswers.rationale: This is a promise to bear arms on behalf of the nation when required.

correctAnswers.text: [번역 필요] give up loyalty to other countries
correctAnswers.rationale: [번역 필요] The Oath of Allegiance includes renouncing allegiance to foreign states.

correctAnswers.text: [번역 필요] defend the Constitution and laws of the United States
correctAnswers.rationale: [번역 필요] New citizens promise to support and defend the Constitution and laws.

correctAnswers.text: [번역 필요] serve (do important work for) the nation (if needed)
correctAnswers.rationale: [번역 필요] Citizens promise to perform work of national importance when required.

wrongAnswers.rationale: Voting is a crucial right and responsibility of a citizen, but it is not a legally required duty or part of the oath.
While English proficiency is a requirement for citizenship, there is no promise to speak only English.

wrongAnswers.text: to never leave the United States
wrongAnswers.rationale: U.S. citizens have the right to travel and live abroad freely.

question: How old do citizens have to be to vote for President?

correctAnswers.rationale: The 26th Amendment set the national voting age at 18.

wrongAnswers.rationale: While some countries or specific local elections allow voting at 16, the U.S. federal voting age is 18.
Before the 26th Amendment was passed, the voting age was 21 in many states.
There is a legally established minimum age to be eligible to vote.

question: What are two ways that Americans can participate in their democracy?

correctAnswers.rationale: Voting is the most fundamental and important way to participate in a democracy.
Participating in a political party allows for direct involvement in the political process.
Helping with the campaign of a candidate or party you support is an important way to participate.
One can serve the community directly by becoming an elected official.
[번역 필요] Community groups help citizens address local concerns and issues.

correctAnswers.text: [번역 필요] give an elected official your opinion on an issue
correctAnswers.rationale: [번역 필요] Contacting elected officials is an important way to make your voice heard.
[번역 필요] Calling your representatives is a direct way to participate in democracy.

correctAnswers.text: [번역 필요] publicly support or oppose an issue or policy
correctAnswers.rationale: [번역 필요] Public advocacy is a key democratic participation method.
[번역 필요] Running for office is one of the most direct ways to participate in democracy.
[번역 필요] Writing letters to newspapers helps share your views with the community.

wrongAnswers.rationale: While staying informed is important, watching the news by itself is not considered active 'participation'.
This is a good way to show patriotism, but it is not participation in the democratic 'process'.
Paying taxes is a legal obligation, which is different from a voluntary act of participation.

question: When is the last day you can send in federal income tax forms?

correctAnswers.rationale: The typical deadline for filing taxes is April 15. (It can be extended if it falls on a weekend or holiday).

wrongAnswers.rationale: January 1st is New Year's Day.
December 31st is the end of the tax year.
July 4th is Independence Day.

question: When must all men register for the Selective Service?

correctAnswers.rationale: Registration must happen within 30 days of turning 18.
While registration should happen at 18, it is possible to register up until age 26.

wrongAnswers.rationale: Registering for the Selective Service is a separate process from actually enlisting and is for a potential draft.
Selective Service registration and voter registration are separate processes.
One must have already registered, if required by age, before applying for citizenship.

question: What is one reason colonists came to America?

correctAnswers.rationale: Many colonists came to escape religious persecution in Europe and practice their faith freely.
Economic motives, such as the chance to acquire wealth and a better life in a new land, were also a major reason.
There was a desire to escape the oppression of kings and nobles and to participate in self-government.
[번역 필요] Many colonists came to America seeking better economic opportunities.
[번역 필요] Religious practice was a major motivation for many colonists.
[번역 필요] Many colonists fled persecution in their home countries.

wrongAnswers.text: para maglingkod sa British King, para magbakasyon, para sakupin ang mga Native Americans
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang mga kolonista ay naghangad na makatakas sa kapangyarihan ng British King, hindi para maglingkod sa kanya. Ang pagtawid sa Atlantic noon ay isang mapanganib na paglalakbay na nakabubuhay, malayo sa bakasyon. Bagaman naganap ang tunggalian at pagsakop, hindi ito ang pangunahing dahilan para pumunta sa America.

wrongAnswers.text: para makatakas sa kahirapan, para maghanap ng ginto, para magtayo ng mga ruta ng kalakalan
wrongAnswers.rationale: Bagaman ang mga oportunidad sa ekonomiya ay isang wastong dahilan, ang mga partikular na motibong ito ay labis na pinapasimple ang mga kumplikadong relihiyoso, pampulitika, at pang-ekonomiyang salik na naging dahilan ng kolonisasyon.

wrongAnswers.text: para magkalat ng Kristiyanismo, para mag-claim ng lupa para sa Spain, para hanapin ang northwest passage
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ito ang mga motibo ng ilang mga eksplorador at misyonero, ngunit hindi ang mga pangunahing dahilan kung bakit ang mga ordinaryong kolonista ay dumating para magtayo ng mga permanenteng pamayanan sa America.

question: Who lived in America before the Europeans arrived?

correctAnswers.rationale: [번역 필요]
[번역 필요]

wrongAnswers.rationale: Millions of indigenous people were living in the Americas long before the Europeans arrived.
Africans were later forcibly brought to America as slaves.
The nation of Canada did not exist at that time; indigenous peoples also inhabited that region.

question: What group of people was taken to America and sold as slaves?

correctAnswers.rationale: Millions of people from Africa were forcibly brought to America and victimized by the institution of slavery.
[번역 필요] People from the African continent were enslaved and brought to America.

wrongAnswers.rationale: Europeans were the immigrants or colonists.
While Native Americans faced oppression and loss of land, they were not the subjects of the transatlantic slave trade.
Immigration from Asia began primarily in the latter half of the 19th century.

question: Why did the colonists fight the British?

correctAnswers.text: because of high taxes (taxation without representation)
correctAnswers.rationale: They were angered by taxes imposed upon them without having their own representatives in the British Parliament.

correctAnswers.text: because the British army stayed in their houses
correctAnswers.rationale: The Quartering Act required colonists to house and feed British soldiers.
The colonists wanted to govern themselves and be free from the unilateral rule of the British government.

wrongAnswers.text: dahil gusto nila ng bagong hari, dahil gusto nilang makipag-alyansa sa France, dahil gusto nilang alisin ang lahat ng buwis
wrongAnswers.rationale: Naghangad silang magtayo ng republika at tuluyang makawala sa pamumuno ng isang hari, hindi lamang palitan siya. Ang alyansa sa France ay isang estratehiya sa panahon ng digmaan, hindi ang pangunahing dahilan para simulan ito. Ang isyu ay hindi ang mga buwis sa pangkalahatan, kundi ang 'hindi makatarungang' mga buwis na ipinataw nang walang kanilang pahintulot.

wrongAnswers.text: dahil sa pang-aapi sa relihiyon, dahil sa mga kahirapan sa ekonomiya, dahil sa mga alitan sa teritoryo
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ito ang mga salik na nag-ambag sa pagkakainis ng mga kolonista, ngunit ang mga pangunahing dahilan para makipaglaban ay pampulitika: mga buwis nang walang representasyon, sapilitang pag-accommodate, at kakulangan ng sariling pamahalaan.

wrongAnswers.text: dahil gusto nila ng agarang kalayaan, dahil ayaw nila sa lahat ng British, dahil gusto nilang mag-expand sa kanluran
wrongAnswers.rationale: Ang mga kolonista ay una nang naghangad ng pagkakasundo at unti-unting naging kalayaan. Ang kanilang pagkakainis ay sa mga patakaran ng British, hindi sa mga indibidwal na British. Ang pagpapalawak sa kanluran ay hindi pangunahing sanhi ng tunggalian.

question: Sino ang sumulat ng Deklarasyon ng Kalayaan?

correctAnswers.rationale: Thomas Jefferson was the principal author of the Declaration of Independence.

wrongAnswers.rationale: George Washington was the Commander in Chief of the Continental Army and the first President.
Abraham Lincoln was the 16th President during the Civil War.
Benjamin Franklin was on the committee, reviewed the document, and signed it, but was not the primary author.

question: When was the Declaration of Independence adopted?

correctAnswers.rationale: This date is celebrated as Independence Day in the United States.

wrongAnswers.rationale: This is the date the U.S. Constitution was signed.
This is the date Christopher Columbus arrived in the Americas.
This is the date of the Battles of Lexington and Concord, which started the Revolutionary War.

question: There were 13 original states. Name three.

correctAnswers.rationale: [번역 필요] New Hampshire was one of the original 13 colonies.
[번역 필요] Massachusetts was one of the original 13 colonies.
[번역 필요] Rhode Island was one of the original 13 colonies.
[번역 필요] Connecticut was one of the original 13 colonies.
[번역 필요] New York was one of the original 13 colonies.
[번역 필요] New Jersey was one of the original 13 colonies.
[번역 필요] Pennsylvania was one of the original 13 colonies.
[번역 필요] Delaware was one of the original 13 colonies.
[번역 필요] Maryland was one of the original 13 colonies.
[번역 필요] Virginia was one of the original 13 colonies.
[번역 필요] North Carolina was one of the original 13 colonies.
[번역 필요] South Carolina was one of the original 13 colonies.
[번역 필요] Georgia was one of the original 13 colonies.

wrongAnswers.rationale: Florida joined the Union as the 27th state in 1845.
California joined the Union as the 31st state in 1850.
Ohio joined the Union as the 17th state in 1803.

question: What happened at the Constitutional Convention?

correctAnswers.rationale: The main purpose of the Constitutional Convention was to create a new framework for government, the Constitution.

correctAnswers.text: [번역 필요] The Founding Fathers wrote the Constitution.
correctAnswers.rationale: [번역 필요] The Founding Fathers gathered at the Constitutional Convention to write the Constitution.

wrongAnswers.text: The Declaration of Independence was written
wrongAnswers.rationale: The Declaration of Independence was written 11 years earlier, at the Continental Congress in 1776.
The Revolutionary War began in 1775 and had already ended before the Constitutional Convention (1787).
George Washington was elected as the first President in 1789, under the Constitution, after the Convention.

question: When was the Constitution written?

correctAnswers.rationale: The Constitution was written at the Constitutional Convention in Philadelphia in 1787.

wrongAnswers.rationale: 1776 is the year the Declaration of Independence was adopted.
1865 is the year the Civil War ended and the 13th Amendment, abolishing slavery, was ratified.
1789 is the year the Constitution went into effect and the U.S. government was officially formed.

question: The Federalist Papers supported the passage of the U.S. Constitution. Name one of the writers.

correctAnswers.rationale: James Madison is also known as the Father of the Constitution.
Hamilton wrote the majority of the papers.
John Jay became the first Chief Justice of the Supreme Court.
[번역 필요] Publius was the pen name used by Madison, Hamilton, and Jay when writing the Federalist Papers.

wrongAnswers.text: Thomas Jefferson, George Washington, John Hancock
wrongAnswers.rationale: Si Jefferson ay isang Anti-Federalist, na tumutol sa mga argumento sa Federalist Papers. Bagaman si Washington ay malakas na tagasuporta ng Konstitusyon, hindi siya isa sa mga may-akda ng Federalist Papers. Si John Hancock ay sikat sa pagiging unang pumirma sa Deklarasyon ng Kalayaan.

wrongAnswers.text: Benjamin Franklin, Samuel Adams, Patrick Henry
wrongAnswers.rationale: Si Franklin ay tagasuporta ng Konstitusyon ngunit hindi sumulat ng Federalist Papers. Sina Adams at Henry ay mga Anti-Federalist na tumutol sa Konstitusyon at hindi magsusulat ng mga papel na sumusuporta dito.

wrongAnswers.text: Thomas Paine, John Adams, Benedict Arnold
wrongAnswers.rationale: Si Paine ay sumulat ng 'Common Sense' at iba pang mga rebolusyonaryong pamphlet ngunit hindi ang Federalist Papers. Si John Adams ay nasa ibang bansa sa panahong ito at hindi nakiisa sa pagsulat ng mga papel na ito. Si Benedict Arnold ay isang traydor sa panahon ng Revolutionary War.

question: What is one thing Benjamin Franklin is famous for?

correctAnswers.rationale: He was a crucial diplomat in securing French support during the Revolutionary War.

correctAnswers.text: oldest member of the Constitutional Convention
correctAnswers.rationale: His wisdom helped mediate conflicts during the convention.
He was deeply invested in the dissemination of knowledge.
[번역 필요] Franklin published Poor Richard's Almanac, which contained weather forecasts, household hints, and proverbs.

correctAnswers.text: [번역 필요] started the first free libraries
correctAnswers.rationale: [번역 필요] Franklin founded the first subscription library in America, which became the model for free public libraries.

wrongAnswers.text: first President of the United States
wrongAnswers.rationale: The first President was George Washington.
The primary author of the Declaration of Independence was Thomas Jefferson.
The General of the Continental Army was George Washington.

question: Who is the 'Father of Our Country'?

correctAnswers.rationale: He is called the 'Father of His Country' for his leadership in the Revolutionary War and for establishing the new nation.

wrongAnswers.rationale: Lincoln is known as the 'Great Emancipator' and the president who preserved the Union.
Jefferson was the author of the Declaration of Independence and the third President.
Franklin was a brilliant diplomat, inventor, and one of the Founding Fathers.

question: Who was the first President?

correctAnswers.rationale: George Washington was unanimously elected as the first President of the United States in 1789.

wrongAnswers.rationale: John Adams was the first Vice President and the second President.
Thomas Jefferson was the third President.

question: What territory did the United States buy from France in 1803?
